subject: RE: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Quickscript practice site
msgSnippet: Hi Jon, ... Thank you very much! This was indeed a major part of the problem. The other part is Mozilla s very different approach to javascript, but it works
messageBody:
Hi Jon,

>I've taken the liberty of balancing the tags, so if you upload this
>code below, it should work ok. Mozilla is known for being very
>insistent on "well-formed" HTML.

Thank you very much! This was indeed a major part of the problem. The
other part is Mozilla's very different approach to javascript, but it
works fine now. (I've tested it in Netscape 7.1 and Internet Explorer
6.)

Thanks again!

--
Jerry

http://www.xs4all.nl/~ransau/quickscript/letters_oefenen/

Hi Jon,

>I've taken the liberty of balancing the tags, so if you upload this
>code below, it should work ok.  Mozilla is known for being very
>insistent on "well-formed" HTML.

Thank you very much! This was indeed a major part of the problem. The
other part is Mozilla's very different approach to javascript, but it
works fine now. (I've tested it in Netscape 7.1 and Internet Explorer
6.)

Thanks again!
